014package org.jdbi.v3.stringtemplate4;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020
021import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.config.ConfiguringAnnotation;
022import org.jdbi.v3.stringtemplate4.internal.UseStringTemplateSqlLocatorImpl;
023
024/**
025 * Configures SQL Object to locate SQL using the {@link StringTemplateSqlLocator#findStringTemplate(Class, String)}
026 * method. If the SQL annotation (e.g. <code>@SqlQuery</code>) defines a value (e.g. <code>@SqlQuery("hello")</code>),
027 * that value (<code>"hello"</code>) will be used for the <code>name</code> parameter; if undefined, the name of the SQL
028 * object method will be used:
029 *
030 * <pre>
031 *     &#064;UseStringTemplateSqlLocator
032 *     interface Viccini {
033 *         &#064;SqlUpdate
034 *         void doTheThing(long id);     // =&gt; StringTemplateSqlLocator.findStringTemplateSql(Viccini.class, "doTheThing")
035 *
036 *         &#064;SqlUpdate("thatOtherThing")
037 *         void doTheThing(String name); // =&gt; StringTemplateSqlLocator.findStringTemplateSql(Viccini.class, "thatOtherThing")
038 *     }
039 * </pre>
040 */
041@ConfiguringAnnotation(UseStringTemplateSqlLocatorImpl.class)
042@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
043@Target({ElementType.TYPE, ElementType.METHOD})
044public @interface UseStringTemplateSqlLocator {}
